qas.question: Who downplayed the contrast and recent past history between German and the Soviets?
How long did the anti-Nazi propaganda machine run before the pact-signing?
A war with the USSR was considered certain according to whom?
Who up-played the contrast and recent past history between German and the Soviets?
Who downplayed the contrast and recent past history between England and the Soviets?
How long did the anti-Soviet propaganda machine run before the pact-signing?
A war with the USSR wasn't considered certain according to whom?
A war with the USSR was considered uncertain according to whom?

context: Soviet propaganda and representatives went to great lengths to minimize the importance of the fact that they had opposed and fought against the Nazis in various ways for <a1_0><b5_0>a decade<b5_0/><a1_0/> prior to signing the Pact. Upon signing the pact, <a0_0><b3_0><b4_0>Molotov<b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/> tried to reassure the Germans of his good intentions by commenting to journalists that "fascism is a matter of taste". For its part, Nazi Germany also did a public volte-face regarding its virulent opposition to the Soviet Union, though <a2_0><b6_0><b7_0>Hitler<b7_0/><b6_0/><a2_0/> still viewed an attack on the Soviet Union as "inevitable".[citation needed]
